s.text: Once I wrote that 1990 review, I became a threat to Gould's social status, an enemy.
If you sit around waiting for some switch to get flicked, you'll have waited too long.
If you sit around waiting for some switch to get flicked, you'll have waited too long.
This claim may turn out to be wrong, but, contrary to Gould's basic indictment of evolutionary psychology, it is neither obvious nor, if true, useless.
So, even if Freud and Skinner had wholly succeeded in explaining how upbringing and social experience shape us, it all would have been a waste of time?

I almost always feel a very strong attraction to doughnuts.
Such differences in behavioral strategy do make Darwinian sense."
Gould's Natural History essay, in keeping with his long tradition of taking courageous political stands, argues against genocide.
It all started in 1990, when I reviewed his book Wonderful Life for the New Republic . I argued, basically, that Gould is a fraud.

After saying "we learn nothing" from current Darwinian theorizing about any "darkness" in human nature, he continues, "At the very most, biology might help us to delimit the environmental circumstances that tend to elicit one behavior rather than the other."
Moreover, men find it easier to have sex without emotional attachment, so they do sometimes want to "wander right off" after sex.
But let's get back to things like infidelity, men's desertion of their families, or even genocide.
You may ask, "Where's the news value in noting that people can refrain from committing genocide?"
You may ask, "Where's the news value in noting that people can refrain from committing genocide?"
